1998.name: Ancestor's Call
1998.text: Put a random minion from each player's hand into the battlefield.

2045.name: Anima Golem
2045.text: At the end of each turn, destroy this minion if it's your only one.
2045.flavorText: The Dark Animus is evil and mysterious and huge and unable to write sentences that utilize proper grammar.

2053.name: Annoy-o-Tron
2053.flavorText: The inventor of the Annoy-o-Tron was immediately expelled from Tinkerschool, Tinkertown, and was eventually exiled from the Eastern Kingdoms altogether.

2096.name: Anodized Robo Cub
2096.flavorText: It's adorable! AND OH MY GOODNESS WHY IS IT EATING MY FACE

2037.name: Antique Healbot
2037.flavorText: They don't make 'em like they used to! (Because of explosions, mostly.)

2059.name: Arcane Nullifier X-21
2059.flavorText: There was some hard talk between gnome magi and engineers about inventing this mech.

2087.name: Blingtron 3000
2087.text: Battlecry: Equip a random weapon for each player.
2087.flavorText: PREPARE PARTY SERVOS FOR IMMEDIATE DEPLOYMENT.

2031.name: Bolvar Fordragon
2031.text: Whenever a friendly minion dies while this is in your hand, gain +1 Attack.
2031.flavorText: Spoiler alert: Bolvar gets melted and then sits on an ice throne and everyone forgets about him.

2067.name: Bomb Lobber
2067.text: Battlecry: Deal 4 damage to a random enemy minion.
2067.flavorText: He lobbies Orgrimmar daily on behalf of bombs.

2018.name: Bouncing Blade
2018.text: Deal 1 damage to a random minion. Repeat until a minion dies.
2018.flavorText: Only goblins would think this was a good idea. Even they are starting to have their doubts.

2036.name: Burly Rockjaw Trogg
2036.text: Whenever your opponent casts a spell, gain +2 Attack.
2036.flavorText: He's burly because he does CrossFit.

2094.name: Call Pet
2094.text: Draw a card. If it's a Beast, it costs (4) less.

2233.name: Clockwork Giant
2233.text: Costs (1) less for each card in your opponent's hand.
2233.flavorText: He and Mountain Giant don't get along.

2050.name: Clockwork Gnome
2050.text: Deathrattle: Add a Spare Part card to your hand.
2050.flavorText: Clockwork gnomes are always asking what time it is.

2030.name: Cobalt Guardian
2030.text: Whenever you summon a Mech, gain Divine Shield.
2030.flavorText: Guardians used to be built out of Adamantium, but production got moved to Gadgetzan and Cobalt was cheap.

2041.name: Cobra Shot
2041.text: Deal 3 damage to a minion and the enemy hero.
2041.flavorText: "Cobra Shot" hurts way, way, way more than "Cobra Cuddle."

2027.name: Coghammer
2027.text: Battlecry: Give a random friendly minion Divine Shield and Taunt.
2027.flavorText: So you ripped this out of a machine, carved some runes on it, stuck it on a handle, and now it's a weapon of great divine power? Seems legit.

1932.name: Cogmaster
1932.text: Has +2 Attack while you have a Mech.
1932.flavorText: After a while, you don't see the cogs and sprockets. All you see is a robot, a spider tank, a deathray...

1989.name: Cogmaster's Wrench
1989.text: Has +2 Attack while you have a Mech.
1989.flavorText: For tightening cogs and smashin' troggs!

2020.name: Crush
2020.text: Destroy a minion. If you have a damaged minion, this costs (4) less.
2020.flavorText: Using this card on your enemies is one of the best things in life, according to some barbarians.

2009.name: Dark Wispers
2009.text: Choose One - Summon 5 Wisps; or Give a minion +5/+5 and Taunt.
2009.flavorText: Don't worry; we fired the person who named this card.

2093.name: Darkbomb
2093.text: Deal 3 damage to a character. If it dies, draw a Shadow spell.
2093.flavorText: If you're looking to make an "Emo" deck, this card is perfect!

1985.name: Demonheart
1985.text: Deal 5 damage to a minion. If it's a friendly Demon, give it +5/+5 instead.
1985.flavorText: Virtually every member of the pro demon lobby is a warlock. Weird.

2078.name: Dr. Boom
2078.text: Battlecry: Summon two 1/1 Boom Bots. WARNING: Bots may explode.

2048.name: Druid of the Fang
2048.text: Battlecry: If you have a Beast, transform this minion into a 7/7.
2048.flavorText: The Druids of the Fang live in the Wailing Caverns. They wear cool snake shirts and tell snake jokes and say "bro" a lot.

2034.name: Dunemaul Shaman
2034.text: Windfury, Overload: (1) 50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.
2034.flavorText: He just closes his eyes and goes for it. Raarararrrarar!

1941.name: Echo of Medivh
1941.text: Put a copy of each friendly minion into your hand.
1941.flavorText: Medivh's echo haunts Karazhan, eternally cheating at chess and Hearthstone.

2075.name: Enhance-o Mechano
2075.text: Battlecry: Give your other minions Windfury, Taunt, or Divine Shield (at random).

2044.name: Explosive Sheep
2044.flavorText: How is this supposed to work? Your enemies think, "Hey! Cute sheep!" and run over to cuddle it?

1991.name: Feign Death
1991.flavorText: The hardest part about doing a "Feign Death" convincingly is learning how to make the right smell. It takes a lot of commitment.

1997.name: Fel Cannon
1997.text: At the end of your turn, deal 2 damage to a non-Mech minion.
1997.flavorText: The box says, "New and improved, with 200% more fel!"

1982.name: Fel Reaver
1982.text: Whenever your opponent plays a card, remove the top 3 cards of your deck.

1939.name: Flame Leviathan
1939.text: Rush When you draw this, deal 2 damage to all characters except Mechs.
1939.flavorText: Mimiron likes to take the Flame Leviathan out on some sweet joyrides.

1927.name: Flamecannon
1927.text: Deal 4 damage to a random enemy minion.
1927.flavorText: Calling something a flamecannon really doesn't do much to distinguish it from other goblin devices.

2068.name: Floating Watcher
2068.text: Whenever your hero takes damage on your turn, gain +2/+2.
2068.flavorText: "Evil Eye Watcher of Doom" was the original name, but marketing felt it was a bit too aggressive.

2052.name: Flying Machine
2052.flavorText: To operate, this contraption needs a hula doll on the dashboard. Otherwise it's just a “falling machine.”

2081.name: Foe Reaper 4000
2081.text: Also damages the minions next to whomever it attacks.
2081.flavorText: Foe reaping is really not so different from harvest reaping, at the end of the day.

2047.name: Force-Tank MAX
2047.flavorText: There is a factory in Tanaris for crafting force-tanks, but it only ever made two, because of cost overruns.

2017.name: Gahz'rilla
2017.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, double its Attack.
2017.flavorText: The Sen'jin High football team is The Gahz'rillas.

2085.name: Gazlowe
2085.text: Whenever you cast a 1-Cost spell, add a random Mech to your hand.
2085.flavorText: Gazlowe was voted "Most Likely to Explode" in high school.

2049.name: Gilblin Stalker
2049.flavorText: "Shhh, I think I hear something." "Ah, it's probably nothing." - Every Henchman

2011.name: Glaivezooka
2011.text: Battlecry: Give a random friendly minion +1 Attack.
2011.flavorText: For the times when a regular bazooka just isn't enough.

2066.name: Gnomeregan Infantry
2066.flavorText: The gnomes are valiant and ready to return to their irradiated, poorly ventilated homeland!

2060.name: Gnomish Experimenter
2060.text: Battlecry: Draw a card. If it's a minion, transform it into a Chicken.
2060.flavorText: He's legitimately surprised every time he turns himself into a chicken.

1988.name: Goblin Auto-Barber
1988.flavorText: This guy is excellent at adjusting your haircut and/or height.

1934.name: Goblin Blastmage
1934.text: Battlecry: If you control a Mech, deal 6 damage randomly split among all enemies.
1934.flavorText: If you can't find a bomb to throw, just pick up any goblin invention and throw that.

2063.name: Goblin Sapper
2063.text: Has +4 Attack while your opponent has 6 or more cards in hand.
2063.flavorText: He’s not such a binge exploder anymore. These days, he only explodes socially.

2225.name: Grove Tender
2225.text: Choose One - Give each player a Mana Crystal; or Each player draws a card.
2225.flavorText: Likes: Hiking and the great outdoors. Dislikes: Goblin shredders and sandals. (Can’t find any that fit!).

2088.name: Hemet Nesingwary
2088.flavorText: It's hard to make a living as a hunter in a world where beasts instantly reappear minutes after you kill them.

2072.name: Hobgoblin
2072.text: Whenever you play a 1-Attack minion, give it +2/+2.
2072.flavorText: Hobgoblins are meeting next week to discuss union benefits. First on the list: dental plan.

2057.name: Illuminator
2057.text: If you control a Secret at the end of your turn, restore 4 Health to your hero.
2057.flavorText: "LUMOS!" is not what they yell. What do you think this is, Hogwarts?

2013.name: Imp-losion
2013.text: Deal 2- 4 damage to a minion. Summon a 1/1 Imp for each damage dealt.
2013.flavorText: The shrapnel is waaaaay worse than the explosion.

2024.name: Iron Juggernaut
2024.text: Battlecry and Deathrattle: Shuffle a Mine into your opponent's deck. When drawn, explode for 10 damage!
2024.flavorText: The Iron Juggernaut guards Orgrimmar and has just earned the "Employee of the Month" award!

1992.name: Iron Sensei
1992.text: At the end of your turn, give another friendly Mech +2/+2.
1992.flavorText: Mechs like learning from him because he really speaks their language. 0110100001101001

2062.name: Jeeves
2062.text: At the end of each player's turn, that player draws until they have 3 cards.
2062.flavorText: This robot is a lean, mean, butlerin' machine.

2074.name: Junkbot
2074.text: Whenever a friendly Mech dies, gain +2/+2.
2074.flavorText: One bot's junk is another bot's AWESOME UPGRADE!

2042.name: Kezan Mystic
2042.text: Battlecry: Take control of a random enemy Secret.
2042.flavorText: They pretend to be wise and enlightened, but they mostly just hate to be left out of a secret.

2014.name: King of Beasts
2014.text: Taunt Has +1 Attack for each other Beast you control.
2014.flavorText: He never sleeps. Not even in the mighty jungle.

1933.name: Light of the Naaru
1933.text: Restore 3 Health. If the target is still damaged, summon a Lightwarden.
1933.flavorText: "Light it up!" - Command given to both Lightwardens and Goblins holding Flamecannons.

1938.name: Lightbomb
1938.text: Deal damage to each minion equal to its Attack.
1938.flavorText: This is what happens when you allow goblins to be priests.

2065.name: Lil' Exorcist
2065.flavorText: Warlocks have the town exorcist on speed dial in case they unleash the wrong demon.

2039.name: Lost Tallstrider
2039.flavorText: The message, "If found, please return to Mulgore," is tattooed on his rear.

2058.name: Madder Bomber
2058.text: Battlecry: Deal 6 damage randomly split between all other characters.

1986.name: Mal'Ganis
1986.text: Your hero is Immune. Your other Demons have +2/+2.
1986.flavorText: Mal'Ganis doesn't like being betrayed, so if you discard him, watch out.

2003.name: Malorne
2003.text: Deathrattle: Go Dormant. Revive after 2 friendly Beasts die.
2003.flavorText: When Malorne isn't mauling hordes of demons, he enjoys attending parties, though he prefers to go stag.

2002.name: Mech-Bear-Cat
2002.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, add a Spare Part card to your hand.
2002.flavorText: Crushes buildings with his BEAR hands.

2046.name: Mechanical Yeti
2046.flavorText: The yetis of Chillwind Point are a source of both inspiration and savage beatings.

1940.name: Mechwarper
1940.flavorText: Mechs that summon mechs? What's next? Donuts that summon donuts? Mmmmm.

2084.name: Mekgineer Thermaplugg
2084.text: Whenever an enemy minion dies, summon a Leper Gnome.
2084.flavorText: He was obsessed with explosives until he discovered knitting. Now he yells, “SWEATERS! MORE SWEATERS!”

2016.name: Metaltooth Leaper
2016.flavorText: Don't leave them out in the rain. In Un'Goro Crater there is a whole colony of rust-tooth leapers.

2071.name: Micro Machine
2071.text: At the start of each turn, gain +1 Attack.
2071.flavorText: This card is the real thing.

2079.name: Mimiron's Head
2079.text: At the start of your turn, if you have at least 3 Mechs, destroy them all and form V-07-TR-0N.
2079.flavorText: Do not push the big red button!

2077.name: Mini-Mage
2077.flavorText: He is sometimes found hiding in the treasure chest in the Gurubashi Arena.

2080.name: Mogor the Ogre
2080.text: All minions have a 50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.
2080.flavorText: Mogor helped reopen the Dark Portal once. You know you're in trouble when you have to rely on an ogre.

2029.name: Muster for Battle
2029.text: Summon three 1/1 Silver Hand Recruits. Equip a 1/4 Weapon.
2029.flavorText: "I'm bringing the guacamole!" – One of the most successful (yet rare) Silver Hand rallying cries

2010.name: Neptulon
2010.text: Battlecry: Add 4 random Murlocs to your hand. Overload: (3)
2010.flavorText: Neptulon is "The Tidehunter". He’s one of the four elemental lords. And he and Ragnaros get together and make really amazing saunas.

2033.name: Ogre Brute
2033.text: 50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.
2033.flavorText: Ogres have really terrible short-term chocolate.

2056.name: Ogre Ninja
2056.text: Stealth 50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.
2056.flavorText: He didn't have the grades to get into ninja school, but his dad pulled some strings.

2022.name: Ogre Warmaul
2022.text: 50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.
2022.flavorText: Simple, misguided, and incredibly dangerous. You know, like most things ogre.

1990.name: One-eyed Cheat
1990.text: Whenever you summon a Pirate, gain Stealth.
1990.flavorText: When pirates say there is no "Eye" in "team," they are very literal about it.

2064.name: Piloted Shredder
2064.flavorText: Once upon a time, only goblins piloted shredders. These days, everyone from Doomsayer to Lorewalker Cho seems to ride one.

2073.name: Piloted Sky Golem
2073.flavorText: The pinnacle of goblin engineering. Includes an espresso machine and foot massager.

2004.name: Powermace
2004.flavorText: People assume that shamans control the elements, but really, they have to ask them stuff and the elements are like, "Yeah ok, sure."

2032.name: Puddlestomper
2032.flavorText: He pays homage to Morgl, the great murloc oracle! (Who doesn't??)

2028.name: Quartermaster
2028.flavorText: His specialty? Dividing things into four pieces.

2172.name: Queen of Pain
2172.flavorText: Her sister is the Queen of Pane who sells windows and shower doors.

2076.name: Recombobulator
2076.text: Battlecry: Transform a friendly minion into a random minion with the same Cost.
2076.flavorText: For when you didn’t combobulate quite right the first time around.

1995.name: Recycle
1995.text: Shuffle an enemy minion into your opponent's deck.
1995.flavorText: Druidic recycling involves putting plastics in one bin and enemy minions in another bin.

2015.name: Sabotage
2015.text: Destroy a random enemy minion. Combo: And your opponent's weapon.
2015.flavorText: Rogues can't stand it. They know you planned it! They are going to set you straight!

2038.name: Salty Dog
2038.flavorText: He's recently recovered from being a "scurvy dog."

2069.name: Scarlet Purifier
2069.text: Battlecry: Deal 2 damage to all minions with Deathrattle.
2069.flavorText: The Scarlet Crusade is doing market research to find out if the "Mauve Crusade" would be better received.

2023.name: Screwjank Clunker
2023.flavorText: If it breaks, just kick it a couple of times while yelling "Durn thing!"

2025.name: Seal of Light
2025.text: Restore 4 Health to your hero and gain +2 Attack this turn.
2025.flavorText: The walrus of Light restores EIGHT Health.

1937.name: Shadowbomber
1937.flavorText: Shadowbomber does her job, but she's kind of phoning it in at this point.

2040.name: Shadowboxer
2040.text: Whenever a minion is healed, deal 1 damage to a random enemy.
2040.flavorText: Punching is its primary function. Also, its secondary function.

2026.name: Shielded Minibot
2026.flavorText: He chooses to believe what he is programmed to believe!

2021.name: Shieldmaiden
2021.flavorText: She has three shieldbearers in her party to supply her with back ups when she gets low on durability.

2043.name: Ship's Cannon
2043.text: After you summon a Pirate, deal 2 damage to a random enemy.
2043.flavorText: If you hear someone yell, "Cannonball!" you're about to get wet. Or crushed.

1936.name: Shrinkmeister
1936.text: Battlecry: Give a minion -3 Attack this turn.
1936.flavorText: After the debacle of the Gnomish World Enlarger, gnomes are wary of size-changing inventions.

2054.name: Siege Engine
2054.text: Whenever you gain Armor, give this minion +1 Attack.

2008.name: Siltfin Spiritwalker
2008.text: Whenever another friendly Murloc dies, draw a card. Overload: (1)
2008.flavorText: The elements respond to anyone who calls them for a worthy cause, even if you call them by yelling, "MRGHRGLGLGL!"

2082.name: Sneed's Old Shredder
2082.flavorText: When Sneed was defeated in the Deadmines, his shredder was sold at auction to an anonymous buyer. (Probably Hogger.)

1928.name: Snowchugger
1928.text: Freeze any character damaged by this minion.
1928.flavorText: Do the slow chant when he waddles by: "Chug! Chug! Chug!"

2249.name: Soot Spewer
2249.text: Spell Damage +1 Battlecry: If you control another Mech, get a random Fire spell.
2249.flavorText: The inventor of the goblin shredder is involved in several patent disputes with the inventor of the soot spewer.

2012.name: Spider Tank
2012.flavorText: "What if we put guns on it?" -Fizzblitz, staring at the spider-transportation-machine

2055.name: Steamwheedle Sniper
2055.text: Your Hero Power can target minions.
2055.flavorText: Goblins seldom have the patience for sniping. Most prefer lobbing explosives.

2035.name: Stonesplinter Trogg
2035.text: Whenever your opponent casts a spell, gain +1 Attack.
2035.flavorText: The only thing worse than smelling troggs is listening to their poetry.

2061.name: Target Dummy
2061.flavorText: The engineering equivalent of a "Kick Me" sticker.

2095.name: Tinker's Sharpsword Oil
2095.text: Give your weapon +3 Attack. Combo: Give a random friendly minion +3 Attack.
2095.flavorText: "Get ready to strike oil!" - Super-cheesy battle cry

2070.name: Tinkertown Technician
2070.text: Battlecry: If you have a Mech, gain +1/+1 and add a Spare Part to your hand.
2070.flavorText: Won't you take me to... Tinkertown?

2083.name: Toshley
2083.text: Battlecry and Deathrattle: Add a Spare Part card to your hand.

1993.name: Trade Prince Gallywix
1993.text: Whenever your opponent casts a spell, gain a copy of it and give them a Coin.
1993.flavorText: Gallywix believes in supply and demand. He supplies the beatings and demands you pay up!

2001.name: Tree of Life
2001.text: Restore all characters to full Health.

2086.name: Troggzor the Earthinator
2086.text: Whenever your opponent casts a spell, summon a Burly Rockjaw Trogg.
2086.flavorText: He keeps earthinating the countryside despite attempts to stop him.

1929.name: Unstable Portal
1929.text: Add a random minion to your hand. It costs (3) less.
1929.flavorText: The denizens of Azeroth have no idea how much work goes into stabilizing portals. We spend like 30% of GDP on portal upkeep.

2051.name: Upgraded Repair Bot
2051.flavorText: It's the same as the previous generation but they slapped the word "upgraded" on it to sell it for double.

1935.name: Velen's Chosen
1935.flavorText: Velen wrote a "Lovely Card" for Tyrande with a picture of the Deeprun Tram that said "I Choo-Choo-Choose you!"

2007.name: Vitality Totem
2007.text: At the end of your turn, restore 4 Health to your hero.
2007.flavorText: You can usually find these at the totemist's market on Saturdays.

1931.name: Vol'jin
1931.flavorText: Vol'jin is a shadow hunter, which is like a shadow priest except more voodoo.

2019.name: Warbot
2019.flavorText: Mass production of warbots was halted when it was discovered that they were accidentally being produced at "sample size."

2234.name: Wee Spellstopper
2234.flavorText: Bane of spellcasters and spelling bees everywhere.

2005.name: Whirling Zap-o-matic
2005.flavorText: If you pay a little extra, you can get it in "candy-apple red."
